LanguageData.GR_BearffaloWool.label: bearffalo wool
LanguageData.GR_BearffaloWool.description: Coarse, strong wool. Bearffalo wool provides heat protection, and decent defense.
LanguageData.GR_HairballWool.label: hairball wool
LanguageData.GR_HairballWool.description: This is a strange wool, very light, and covered with what seems to be a lattice of coarse hairs. It provides excellent heat insulation due to its thermostatic properties.
LanguageData.GR_BoomffaloWool.label: boomffalo wool
LanguageData.GR_BoomffaloWool.description: Brittle, strange smelling wool. Not the best wool to craft apparel with, though it's better than nothing. Provides nice heat insulation.
LanguageData.GR_MuffalopeWool.label: muffalope wool
LanguageData.GR_MuffalopeWool.description: This wool seems to be constantly dripping unstable chemical compounds. Not the best wool to craft apparel with, though it's better than nothing. Provides nice heat insulation.
LanguageData.GR_ChickenffaloWool.label: chickenffalo wool
LanguageData.GR_ChickenffaloWool.description: The strands of this pure white wool are incredibly small and complex. Gives good defense against sharp attacks for a wool.
LanguageData.GR_MuffalochickenWool.label: muffalochicken wool
LanguageData.GR_MuffalochickenWool.description: This seems to be an amalgamation of feathers and wool, perfectly interweaved. Gives nice defense against blunt attacks, as well as insulation.
LanguageData.GR_MuffalowolfWool.label: muffalowolf wool
LanguageData.GR_MuffalowolfWool.description: This dark grey wool is stylish and very warm.
LanguageData.GR_WolffaloWool.label: wolffalo wool
LanguageData.GR_WolffaloWool.description: This dark grey wool is stylish and very warm.
LanguageData.GR_ChickenspiderSilk.label: chickenspider silk
LanguageData.GR_ChickenspiderSilk.description: Fabric spun from fibers extracted from chickenspiders. Resists blunt and sharp damage easily, but provides almost no protection against extreme heat.
LanguageData.GR_SpidersnakeSilk.label: spidersnake silk
LanguageData.GR_SpidersnakeSilk.description: Fabric spun from fibers extracted from spidersnakes. A balanced fabric to make apparel from.
LanguageData.GR_MuffalopedeChitin.label: muffalopede wool
LanguageData.GR_MuffalopedeChitin.description: Insectoid chitin can be used as a material to craft apparel. It provides excellent protection against blunt attacks.
LanguageData.GR_WolfsnakeSkin.label: wolfsnake skin
LanguageData.GR_WolfsnakeSkin.description: Shed skin from a wolfsnake. Light, strong, and insulates well.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumbearWool.label: thrumbear wool
LanguageData.GR_ThrumbearWool.description: Thrumbear wool is thick and warm. Probably the best wool in the animal kingdom.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumffaloWool.label: thrumffalo wool
LanguageData.GR_ThrumffaloWool.description: Thrumffalo wool is the best protection against extreme climates there is.
LanguageData.GR_MechaWool.label: mechanoid wool
LanguageData.GR_MechaWool.description: This wool seems to be strengthened by plasteel micro-fibers, and covered with advanced circuitry.
